metadata.title: CVE-2015-6760 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Image11::map function in renderer/d3d/d3d11/Image11.cpp in libANGLE, asused in Google Chrome before 46.0.2490.71, mishandles mapping failuresafter device-lost events, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (invalid read or write) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via vectors involving a removed device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
